description: Wnt signaling plays key roles in development and disease, by regulating the stability of its key effector βcat.  In the absence of Wnt signals, βcat is phosphorylated by the Wnt-regulatory destruction complex, ubiquitinated by an SCF-class E3 ubiquitin ligase, and destroyed by the proteasome.  Binding of Wnt ligands to their Frizzled/LRP receptors stabilizes βcat, via the cytoplasmic effector Dsh.  Here we explore two important questions in the field:  Is there a direct transfer of βcat from the destruction complex to the E3 ligase, and how does Dsh interaction with the destruction complex protein Axin regulate destruction complex function?

modifications.name: No PTMs are included in the dataset

terms.name: Reference
terms.value: Schaefer KN, Pronobis M, Williams CE, Zhang S, Bauer L, Goldfarb D, Yan F, Major MB, Peifer M. Wnt Regulation: Exploring Axin-Disheveled interactions and defining mechanisms by which the SCF E3 ubiquitin ligase is recruited to the destruction complex. Mol Biol Cell. 2020:mbcE19110647

title: Wnt Regulation: Exploring Axin-Disheveled interactions and defining mechanisms by which the SCF E3 ubiquitin ligase is recruited to the destruction complex
